instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3209: What is 820-3209? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.R7005: What is R7005? resistor between charger and CHGR_DCIN pin of ISL6259, if CHGR_DCIN is low then this resistor is probably blown. When PPBUS_G3H is low or missing this is something to check if your model has CHGR_DCIN along R7005. .
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light, no fan spin. ppbus low
threads.message:
the current sensing resisters were toast as well as <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> (short to ground on current sensing pins)
<RESISTOR>R7005</RESISTOR> was also high resistance. replaced all of this and all have the correct values now.

PPbus is on 4.3 volts.
the SMC SCL and SDA lines are both 3.42v

I also replaced <TRANSISTOR>Q7080</TRANSISTOR> with no change to PPbus. 

I have seen a couple of times that it has gone up to 8.4v but that made no difference. It's not pulsing either

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light, no fan spin. ppbus low
threads.message:
Check all traces and solders for <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>.
Change <CAPACITOR>C7025</CAPACITOR>, just in case.
Check resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28 directly between chip pins.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light, no fan spin. ppbus low
threads.message:
All good in regards to the traces and solder joints.
Changed <CAPACITOR>C7025</CAPACITOR> and checked if its turned into a wire but it was fine. However pin 23/27 have direct continuity. i'm guessing this is on purpose

Resistance between 17/18 is 2-3 ohms and on 27/28 it's around 20-25 ohms
so current sensing seems normal?
Feel like this is starting to sound like an SMC issue...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light, no fan spin. ppbus low
threads.message: would it help if i told you i had a suspicion the battery was bad? can a battery cause ppbus faults like this? such as broken current sensing etc?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light, no fan spin. ppbus low
threads.message: for whatever reason <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> was again shorted at pins 27/28

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light, no fan spin. ppbus low
threads.message:
SOLVED. replaced <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> again and made sure current sensing circuit has correct resistance. all working.

Moral of the story, just because you replace a part doesn't mean it's not faulty again.

thank you!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light, no fan spin. ppbus low
threads.message:
Very true!
I just changed 3 KBCs in a Lenovo board, all new from China.
At least the third one was good...
